annotation: (7), not clear if noun or verb
usually takes a word for 'skin' as a subject: pu-nia malelen ki i  mɔtɔ 'He is scared of snake.' (lit. his skin fears a snake.)
great fear; e.g. to be killed

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect
annotation: M: mawadut La: mawat Le: hawàda

language: Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: not sure of -kina bit here, but Bender et al. (2003) give ma-aku 'afraid' and ma-aka 'fear s/one', so I've coded as cognate
not sure of -kina bit here, but Bender et al. (2003) give ma-aku 'afraid' and ma-aka 'fear s/one', so I've coded as cognate
feel unwelcome, ill at ease, awkward
to be afraid to do something, PNEM, PSEM
this might be a Malay loan although the ma prefix i would then be hard to explain.BB.
(6-1), not clear if noun or verb
as in a child fears a man
be scared of it, be afraid of it
